channel.title: [PI]How To Disable Wearing Any Capes But A Exception Of 2 Capes In Pvp[PI]
channel.description: I want to disable wearing capes in clan wars for the exception of 2 team capes please team viewer or explain very well.

item.title: [PI]How To Disable Wearing Any Capes But A Exception Of 2 Capes In Pvp[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Taharahora Taharahora
item.description:
@Taharahora wrote:

okay, at the top of the wearitem.java add

import server.model.items.ItemAssistant;

NOTE: I am using a very heavily moded PI your path to item assistant might be differen’t

server.model.items <- these are the folders to get to itemassistant.java, if your folders are different put your path in its place.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How To Disable Wearing Any Capes But A Exception Of 2 Capes In Pvp[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Taharahora Taharahora
item.description:
@Taharahora wrote:

if (absX >= 3368 && absX <= 3394 && absY >= 2913 && absY <= 2949) { if (targetSlot == 1 || targetSlot == 0) { c.sendMessage("You can't wear your own capes!"); return false; //stays same } }

Might get import error on the absX and absY, tell me if you do.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How To Disable Wearing Any Capes But A Exception Of 2 Capes In Pvp[PI]
item.dc:creator: @manny458 manny458
item.description:
@manny458 wrote:

[quote=“Taharahora, post:4, topic:461772”]in the wearItem(int wearID, int slot) method

add this in it

if (CastleWars.isInCw(c) || CastleWars.isInCwWait(c)) { //<- replace that to isin(your wildy area) if (targetSlot == 1 || targetSlot == 0) { //(stays same) c.sendMessage("You can't wear your own capes!"); //stays same return false; //stays same } }[/quote]

if (absX >= 3368 && absX <= 3394 && absY >= 2913 && absY <= 2949) //<- replace that to isin(your wildy area) if (targetSlot == 1 || targetSlot == 0) { //(stays same) c.sendMessage("You can't wear your own capes!"); //stays same return false; //stays same } }
= me 100 errors…

Read full topic

in the wearItem(int wearID, int slot) method

add this in it

if (CastleWars.isInCw(c) || CastleWars.isInCwWait(c)) { //<- replace that to isin(your wildy area) if (targetSlot == 1 || targetSlot == 0) { //(stays same) c.sendMessage("You can't wear your own capes!"); //stays same return false; //stays same } }

item.title: [PI]How To Disable Wearing Any Capes But A Exception Of 2 Capes In Pvp[PI]
item.dc:creator: @manny458 manny458
item.description:
@manny458 wrote:

[quote=“Taharahora, post:2, topic:461772”]in the wearItem(int wearID, int slot) method

add this in it

[code]Code:

            /*
             * Castle wars
             */
            if (CastleWars.isInCw(c) || CastleWars.isInCwWait(c)) {
                if (targetSlot == 1 || targetSlot == 0) {
                    c.sendMessage("You can't wear your own capes or hats in a Castle Wars Game!");
                    return false;
                }
            }

[/code]

to tired to explain more, this is the general idea[/quote]
oh common. explain a little more atleast

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How To Disable Wearing Any Capes But A Exception Of 2 Capes In Pvp[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Taharahora Taharahora
item.description:
@Taharahora wrote:

in the wearItem(int wearID, int slot) method

add this in it

[code]Code:

            /*
             * Castle wars
             */
            if (CastleWars.isInCw(c) || CastleWars.isInCwWait(c)) {
                if (targetSlot == 1 || targetSlot == 0) {
                    c.sendMessage("You can't wear your own capes or hats in a Castle Wars Game!");
                    return false;
                }
            }

[/code]

to tired to explain more, this is the general idea
